ETYMOLOGY: From the verb 'open' (Old English *openian*, from Proto-Germanic) + the suffix '-er' (Old English *-ere*), forming agent nouns or nouns denoting instruments.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A tool or device used for opening something, such as bottles, cans, or letters.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用于打开某物（如瓶子、罐头或信件）的工具或装置。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Could you pass me the bottle opener, please? I can't get this lid off.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 请把开瓶器递给我好吗？我打不开这个盖子。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The first event, game, or performance in a series or season.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 系列赛或赛季中的首场比赛、首个事件或首场演出。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The team won their season opener with a dominant performance.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这支队伍以压倒性的表现赢得了他们的赛季揭幕战。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A remark, action, or gesture intended to start a conversation or interaction, especially in an informal context.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 旨在开始对话或互动的话语、行动或姿态，尤其指在非正式场合。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: His funny anecdote served as a perfect opener for the networking event.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他有趣的轶事为这次社交活动提供了一个完美的开场白。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person whose role is to open something, or, in cricket, one of the two players who start the batting for their team.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 扮演开启某物角色的人；在板球运动中，指为队伍开局击球的两名球员之一。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: As an opener in cricket, he is known for his aggressive start.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 作为一名板球开局击球手，他以其富有侵略性的开局而闻名。

REGISTER: General English; some meanings are more common in specific contexts like sports or informal social interactions.
